00035 /**
00036  * \file
00037  *         Real-timer header file for STM32W.
00038  * \author
00039  *         Salvatore Pitrulli <salvopitru@users.sourceforge.net>
00040  */
00041 
00042 #ifndef __RTIMER_ARCH_H__
00043 #define __RTIMER_ARCH_H__
00044 
00045 #include "contiki-conf.h"
00046 #include "sys/clock.h"
00047 
00048 
00049 #define RT_RESOLUTION RES_171US
00050 
00051 
00052 #define RES_341US 0
00053 #define RES_171US 1
00054 #define RES_85US  2
00055 
00056 // If it was possible to define a custom size for the rtimer_clock_t type:
00057 //typedef unsigned long long rtimer_clock_t;  // Only 48 bit are used. It's enough for hundreds of years.
00058 
00059 #if RT_RESOLUTION == RES_341US
00060 #define RT_PRESCALER 12      // CK_CNT =  PCLK/4096 = 12 MHz/4096 = 2929.6875 Hz
00061 #define RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND 2930   // One tick: 341.33 us. Using this value we will delay about 9.22 sec after a day.
00062 #endif /* RT_RESOLUTION == RES_341US */
00063 
00064 #if RT_RESOLUTION == RES_171US
00065 #define RT_PRESCALER 11      // CK_CNT =  PCLK/2048 = 12 MHz/2048 = 5859.375 Hz
00066 #define RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND 5859    // One tick: 170.66 us. Using this value we will advance about 5.53 sec after a day.
00067 #endif /* RT_RESOLUTION == RES_171US */
00068 
00069 #if RT_RESOLUTION == RES_85US
00070 #define RT_PRESCALER 10      // CK_CNT =  PCLK/2048 = 12 MHz/2048 = 5859.375 Hz
00071 #define RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND 11719    // One tick: 85.33 us. Using this value we will delay about 1.84 sec after a day.
00072 #endif /* RT_RESOLUTION == RES_85US */
00073 
00074 rtimer_clock_t rtimer_arch_now(void);
00075 //#define rtimer_arch_now() clock_time()
00076 
00077 void rtimer_arch_disable_irq(void);
00078 void rtimer_arch_enable_irq(void);
00079 
00080 #endif /* __RTIMER_ARCH_H__ */
